blocks.name: output
blocks.comment: README: Check the variables below, perform a manual run to successfully deploy all apps the first time, then schedule this automation to run weekly or monthly.

inputs.value:
## Qlik Cloud Monitoring App deployer

The Qlik Cloud monitoring app deployer automates the installation and update of the monitoring apps from the [Qlik Cloud monitoring apps repository](https://github.com/qlik-oss/qlik-cloud-monitoring-apps). Check the variables below, then run manually, or schedule for when you'd like your apps updated.

**Some apps require specific license entitlements and will not be installed if these criteria are not met.**

blocks.name: sharedSpaceName
blocks.comment: Enter a space name to use as the staging space. A space will be created if it does not exist.

blocks.name: managedSpaceName
blocks.comment: Enter a space name to use as the managed space. A space will be created if it does not exist.

blocks.name: versionsToKeep
blocks.comment: If you wish to keep previously deployed apps in the staging space, enter a number of apps to keep. Set to 0 to always delete all apps from the shared space. Default = 0

blocks.name: getCurrentUserId
blocks.displayName: Qlik Cloud Services - Get Current User Id
blocks.comment:
RUN: Don't edit below this point.
Find current user ID.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.comment: Get record for the current user.

inputs.value:
| Variable | Value |
| -------- | ------- |
| monitoringAppsToInstall | { implode: {$.configuredMonitoringApps}, ',' } |
| refreshConnectorCredentials | {$.refreshConnectorCredentials} |
| sharedSpaceName | {$.sharedSpaceName} |
| managedSpaceName | {$.managedSpaceName} | 
| versionsToKeep | {$.versionsToKeep} |
| Current User | {$.getUser.id} |
| Tenant hostname | {$.tenantHostname} |
| Template version | {$.currentTemplateVersionNum} |

blocks.name: condition3
blocks.comment: Ensures that the current user has the TenantAdmin role. This is required for license checks and the detail app.

blocks.name: getLicenseOverview
blocks.displayName: Qlik Cloud Services - Get License Overview
blocks.comment: Get license to check for capacity-based flags.

inputs.value:
## Deployment progress

Deployment is in progress. Status will be updated below.

| Step | Status |
| -------- | ------- |
| Shared space lookup | Found {$.filterList4.item.type} space matching name [{$.sharedSpaceName}]({$.tenantHostname}analytics/catalog?space_filter={$.sharedSpaceId}). |

blocks.displayName: Filter over Qlik Cloud Services - Search Spaces - Filter List 4
blocks.comment: Filter for exact name match for shared space.

blocks.comment: If the space type is not shared, exit; otherwise, apply the Can Manage role.

blocks.name: errorTitle
blocks.comment: A space of the wrong type was found with the configured shared space name.

operations.value: A space of the wrong type was found with the configured shared space name.

blocks.comment: Variable to store detailed error message.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Exiting, an existing space with a type other than `shared` was found for the provided shared space name. Try another shared space name.

blocks.comment: Get a list of members in the shared space.

blocks.name: condition15
blocks.comment: If the user is found, update; otherwise, add the user to the shared space with the facilitator role.

blocks.name: condition16
blocks.comment: If the user does not have the facilitator role, add it.

blocks.comment: List variable to add the facilitator role, along with the existing roles, to the user in the shared space.

blocks.comment: Add the facilitator role to the user in the shared space.

| Shared space permissions | No changes made. |

blocks.displayName: Qlik Cloud Services - Add Member To Space

inputs.value: | Shared space permissions | Added user to shared space. |

inputs.value: | {$.loop2.item.name} - Cleanup | > Configured to keep {$.versionsToKeep} apps, deleted app {add: {$.cleanupCounter}, 1} from shared space: [{$.searchItems.item.resourceAttributes.name}]. |

blocks.comment: Increment the variable by 1 to get the total count of apps that have been backed up in the shared space.

blocks.comment: Determine tenant hostname. Use alias if available.

blocks.name: refreshConnectorCredentials
blocks.comment: Configure whether to refresh the REST credentials on every run. By default, set to 1, which will recreate the credentials each time. Set to 0 to leave the API keys unchanged.

blocks.comment: Retrieve installer manifest from Qlik to determine latest version of this automation.

blocks.comment: If the automation version is greater than or equal to the manifest version.

blocks.name: condition5
blocks.comment: If not a capacity product, fail if user doesn't have a professional license as we cannot guarantee these can be auto assigned.

blocks.name: errorTitle
blocks.comment: Missing a professional entitlement on the executing user.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Missing professional entitlement on executing user.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Exiting, could not find a professional entitlement assigned to current user. Please assign a professional entitlement to your user. A log out may be required to clear caches.

blocks.name: userRoles
blocks.comment: Collect all roles for API key access checks.

blocks.comment: Loop over custom roles to build list of permissions.

blocks.name: condition4
blocks.comment: If api-keys permission not present, exit.

blocks.name: errorTitle
blocks.comment: Missing the api-keys permission on the executing user.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Missing api-keys permission on executing user.

blocks.name: errorDetail
blocks.comment: Variable to store detailed error message.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Exiting, could not find the `api-keys` permission assigned to current user. Please either add this permission to a custom role and assign that to your user, or allow this permission for all users. Formerly, access to API keys was controlled by the `Developer` role, which is deprecated. A log out may be required to clear caches.

blocks.name: goToLabel3
blocks.comment: Go to the label named error.

blocks.name: rawAPIRequest2
blocks.displayName: Qlik Cloud Services - Raw API Request 2
blocks.comment: Get API key settings for max expiry.

blocks.name: condition6
blocks.comment: Are API keys enabled on the tenant, or has tenant been migrated through TLV-750?

blocks.name: errorTitle
blocks.comment: API keys are disabled on the tenant, and must be enabled (until TLV-750 implemented).

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: API keys are not enabled on the tenant.

blocks.name: errorDetail
blocks.comment: Variable to store detailed error message.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Exiting, API keys must be enabled on the tenant to use the monitoring apps since they rely on an API key for the REST data connections used for loading data from Qlik Cloud. Please enable API keys and try again.

blocks.name: goToLabel5
blocks.comment: Go to the label named error.

blocks.name: isCapacityTenant
blocks.comment: Check for presence of "QLIK SMT" for capacity tenants.

blocks.name: configuredMonitoringApps
blocks.comment: Configure which monitoring apps to install & maintain. Delete the record to skip installing/updating it. Must be a case sensitive match with the app names in the manifest.

inputs.value: | Confirmed apps in scope | Will load the following monitoring apps based on license & application availability: **{implode: { $.monitoringAppsToInstall[*].name }, ','}** |
| Missing role | User is missing required role `{ $.loop.item }`. Please assign to your user and re-run. |

blocks.name: errorTitle
blocks.comment: API keys are disabled on the tenant, and must be enabled (until TLV-750 implemented).

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: User is missing required roles: { implode: { $.missingRoles }, ',' }.

blocks.name: errorDetail
blocks.comment: Variable to store detailed error message.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }
operations.value: Exiting, user is missing one or more roles required by one of the monitoring apps: `{ implode: { $.missingRoles }, ',' }`. Review the output for the missing role, assign to your user, and try again.

inputs.value: | {$.loop2.item.name} - Verify | Excluding existing app [{$.loop3.item.name}]({$.tenantHostname}sense/app/{$.loop3.item.resourceId}) in [{$.managedSpaceName}]({$.tenantHostname}analytics/catalog?space_filter={$.managedSpaceId}). **Cannot upgrade since it is missing a version tag. This may result in another copy of the app being deployed.** |

inputs.value: | {$.loop2.item.name} - Verify | Excluding existing app [{$.loop3.item.name}]({$.tenantHostname}sense/app/{$.loop3.item.resourceId}) in [{$.managedSpaceName}]({$.tenantHostname}analytics/catalog?space_filter={$.managedSpaceId}). **Cannot upgrade since it has multiple version tags. This may result in another copy of the app being deployed.** |

| {$.loop2.item.name} - Verify | Found existing app [{$.loop3.item.name}]({$.tenantHostname}sense/app/{$.loop3.item.resourceId}) in [{$.managedSpaceName}]({$.tenantHostname}analytics/catalog?space_filter={$.managedSpaceId}). **Will be updated from {replace: { $.filterList8[0].name }, 'QCMA - '} to {$.loop2.item.version}.** |

blocks.name: workingAppExists
blocks.comment: Set to 1 to skip new app import.

blocks.name: workingAppExists
blocks.comment: Set to 1 to skip new app import.

inputs.value: | {$.loop2.item.name} - Prepare | > Pulling and importing version {$.loop2.item.version} of {$.loop2.item.name} from manifest to shared space. |

blocks.name: goToLabel10
blocks.comment: Go to the label named error.

blocks.name: reloadNow
blocks.comment: Configure whether to run a reload on every run. By default, set to 1, which will reload every app. Set to 0 to skip a reload.

blocks.name: reloadScheduleHour
blocks.comment: Set to the hour of the day (UTC) when the apps should reload. Will create a schedule for each app at this time. Will replace any other schedules on the app. Leave empty to manage schedules yourself.

blocks.name: DoReload
blocks.comment: Trigger app reload. Warn on failure since will fail if a reload is ongoing.

settings.displayValue: Warning - Continue Automation and report errors

inputs.value: | Reload | Configured to reload all apps now, triggering reloads. |
| Reload schedule | Creating or replacing reload schedules. |

blocks.name: condition35
blocks.comment: If reloadScheduleHour is not empty, manage schedule.

inputs.value: | Reload | Skipping reload step per configuration. |
| Reload schedule | Skipping reload schedule setup per configuration. |

blocks.displayName: Qlik Cloud Services - Raw API List Request 2

settings.displayValue: Ignore - Continue Automation and ignore errors

settings.displayValue: Ignore - Continue Automation and ignore errors

blocks.name: getApp
blocks.comment: Retrieve the app definition since this format will match the published app format used in liveApps later. This is more reliable than calling items right after publishing.
